metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45414 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
If a Thunderbird user quoted from an HTML email, for example by replying tothe email, and the email contained either a VIDEO tag with the POSTERattribute or an OBJECT tag with a DATA attribute, a network request to thereferenced remote URL was performed, regardless of a configuration to blockremote content. An image loaded from the POSTER attribute was shown in thecomposer window. These issues could have given an attacker additionalcapabilities when targetting releases that did not yet have a fix forCVE-2022-3033 which was reported around three months ago. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.5.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45414` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
